skill.name: doc-coauthoring
skill.description: Guide users through a structured workflow for co-authoring documentation. Use when user wants to write documentation, proposals, technical specs, decision docs, or similar structured content. This workflow helps users efficiently transfer context, refine content through iteration, and verify the doc works for readers. Trigger when user mentions writing docs, creating proposals, drafting specs, or similar documentation tasks.

skill.author: anthropics

security_audit.summary: Official skill with procedural guidance and no executable code. It references optional integrations and file creation steps for drafting. Overall risk is minimal.

content.value_statement: Complex documents fail when context and structure are weak. This skill guides you through context gathering, drafting, and reader testing.
actual_capabilities: Ask structured context questions before drafting
Propose sections and create a document scaffold with placeholders
Guide section drafting with questions, brainstorming, and curation
Apply iterative refinements to drafted sections
Run reader testing steps with predicted reader questions
limitations: Does not access external documents without integrations
Requires user input for content and decisions
Does not verify facts or external links
Reader testing with sub-agents depends on platform support

use_cases.title: Draft a PRD
use_cases.description: Build a PRD with goals, scope, and decisions through guided sections.

use_cases.title: Write a technical spec
use_cases.description: Capture architecture, tradeoffs, and steps with structured prompts and refinement.

use_cases.title: Create a decision doc
use_cases.description: Document options, rationale, and risks with iterative drafting and testing.

prompt_templates.title: Start a doc
prompt_templates.prompt: Guide me through your doc co-authoring workflow for a technical spec. Ask context questions and build the section outline.

prompt_templates.title: Draft a section
prompt_templates.prompt: We are drafting the Approach section. Ask clarifying questions, brainstorm options, then draft the section.

prompt_templates.title: Refine a section
prompt_templates.prompt: Refine my proposal section after I choose what to keep and remove. Use iterative edits until it is clear.

prompt_templates.title: Reader testing
prompt_templates.scenario: You want a fresh reader check
prompt_templates.prompt: Run reader testing on my document. Predict reader questions and report gaps that need fixes.

output_examples.input: Help me draft a decision doc for migrating our API gateway
output: Questions about audience, impact, and constraints
Drafted core decision section after curation

best_practices: Provide a focused context dump before drafting
Start with the section that has the most uncertainty
Use reader testing to find hidden assumptions
anti_patterns: Skipping context gathering and jumping to a full draft
Editing the document without sharing changes back
Ignoring reader testing when multiple stakeholders will read it

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes, it is a workflow skill that works across those platforms.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It relies on your input and does not verify facts or external data.

faq.question: Can it integrate with docs or chat tools?
faq.answer: It can use connected tools when available; otherwise you must paste content.

faq.question: How is my data handled?
faq.answer: Content stays in the session unless you connect external tools.

faq.question: What if the draft feels generic?
faq.answer: Provide more context and request another refinement cycle.

faq.question: How does it compare to freeform drafting?
faq.answer: It adds structured steps and reader testing to reduce gaps.
